Font Family

The font stacks that come by default with Eezo have been defined to maximize compatibility and aesthetics. For the sans/serif type Noto comes first, followed by some popular/common open fonts, and then finally some pleasant system defaults.

Even if you're not a developer/author from The East designing for eastern screens with CJK text; your website is still probably being viewed and translated by users from there. So there's also pleasant CJK system defaults.

class name font stack
.txt-code
Menlo, Monaco, Consolas, monospace
.txt-heading
Proxima Nova, Lato, Avenir, Arial, sans-serif, 微软雅黑体, 微软雅黑, Microsoft YaHei, 黑体, SimHei, 冬青黑体, Hiragino Sans GB, 华文黑体, STHeiti, sans-serif
.txt-sans
Noto Sans, Open Sans, Lato, Segoe UI, Helvetica Neue, Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif, 微软雅黑体, 微软雅黑, Microsoft YaHei, 黑体, SimHei, 冬青黑体, Hiragino Sans GB, 华文黑体, STHeiti, sans-serif
.txt-serif
Noto Serif, Merriweather, Georgia, serif, 新細明體, PMingLiU, 华文细黑, STXihei, 宋体, SimSun, serif

Default Classes

<body class="txt-serif">
 
  <h1 class="txt-heading"> heading <h1>
  <p class="txt-sans"> sub-heading </p>
  <pre class="txt-code"> code style </pre>
 
</body>

Customising

Default Classes

To change the prefix from txt to something else, you may use the $font-family-prop variable to override.

// change the default class:
// .txt-*  ->  .ff-*
$font-family-prop: "ff";

Custom Fonts

Supply a $custom-fonts map to add your own custom font sets:

// change the sans-serif font family, and
// add a new font-family:
$custom-fonts: (
  sans: "Helvetica",
  chuck: "Chuck Norris"
);

Combined

The previous two customisations combined:

// would result in css like:
.ff-sans { font-family: "Helvetica"; }
.ff-chuck { font-family: "Chuck Norris"; }

/src/components/text/_family.scss
